attributes.action: Make it compulsory for airlines to offer free extra leg room for tall people
attributes.additional_details: I as someone whom is 6ft 6 I find flying an extremely emotional time due to the servere lack of room and comfort. I believe that if I was different in any other physicial position That would alter how I flew it would be felt with accordingly but due to society seeing being tall as a positive thing we don’t deserve help when needed. I personally shouldn’t have to pay extra for a chair I cannot fit in comfortably a specially when the person in front reclines their chair.
attributes.background: I believe that airlines should offer extra leg room free of charge for anyone above 6ft 2inch because it’s unavoidable and they shouldn’t be forced to be made to feel uncomfortable physically and mentally. Wouldn’t happen if I had a obesity problem or disability.

rejection.details: This is a commercial decision for airlines, not the UK Government or Parliament.
